item.description:
Cape Ann's many wild areas have been sitting quietly untrod by Seacoast Outdoors boots for far too long. And Gloucester's pubs have fish & chips to be eaten and ales to be drunken.

Recently, we hiked Ravenswood Reserve. This week, it's the infamous Dogtown Commons!

Dogtown Commons was once a respectable community of 100 Cape Ann families beginning in the 17th century. But eventually it descended into a ghost town inhabited by witches, feral animals, and half-feral humans! There are dozens of numbered cellar holes from long-ago residents, and tales of witches' curses and howling dogs roaming the woods.

And it is surrounded by hundreds of acres of forest with miles of trails to explore.



There are also engraved boulders with inspirational messages that were carved during the Depression by out-of-work stonecutters! Don't know if that's cool... or creepy...

You may not know it but believe me, you are very sorry that you missed last Sunday's trip! Don't miss this one!

And... Gloucester promises seafaring history and lots o' ale! 

We'll hike for 3-4 hours then head to Cape Ann Brewing for a pint or two. And if by then we want to make the day last a while longer, we can walk to Dog Bar around the corner, where there will be live Irish jam beginning at ~5pm.

Carpool: 10:45 AM @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. There are two parking lots. Meet in the back of the overflow lot - the lot farthest from the main bus terminal building, farther up Grafton Ave. Meet at the very back of the lot. Call me if you can't find us! 

Newburyport Carpool: 11AM. C&J Bus lot, 90 Storey Ave/Rt 113 at I-95. (Post a comment if you want to meet here.)

Ironically, No Dogs on this hike. Rough!

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Mysterious DOGTOWN and Fisherman's ALE!
